intro: Limonium ursanum, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to coastal and alpine environments. Limonium ursanum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
